SqlRetryIntervalBaseEnumerator.summary: Generates a sequence of time intervals.

ctor1.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a default value of zero for the gap time, minimum, and maximum interval time.

ctor2.param: The gap time used to calculate the time delay before each attempt.
The maximum time allowed as a gap time.
The minimum time allowed as a gap time.
ctor2.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

GapTimeInterval.summary: The default gap time of each interval.

MinTimeInterval.summary: The minimum allowed time interval value.

MaxTimeInterval.summary: The maximum allowed time interval value.

Current.summary: Gets the element in the collection at the current position of the enumerator.

Reset.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the collection.

Validate.param: The gap time of each interval. Must be between 0 and 120 seconds.
Maximum time interval value. Must be between 0 and 120 seconds.
Minimum time interval value. Must be less than maximum time interval and between 0 and 120 seconds.

GetNextInterval.returns: Returns the next gap time interval.

MoveNext.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
MoveNext.returns: Returns , if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

Dispose.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

Clone.summary: Creates a new object that is a copy of the current instance.
Clone.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.
